The occupational therapist smiled as young Tim buttoned his shirt independently for the first time. His motor skills, damaged in the car accident, were improving through daily practice with special tools. "Next we'll work on tying shoelaces," she said, placing colorful laces on the therapy table. Tim's eyes lit up - this job-related recovery process was making him regain confidence.
